db:abstract.db:para: Provides a complete reference for CMake variables implemented in Qt. <Unknown command>contentspage Build with CMake.

db:section.db:title: Module variables
db:section.db:para: When you use find_package, the resulting imported targets are created for use with target_link_libraries. Some variables are populated with information required to configure the build. For each module, the name of its imported target matches the name of the module with a "Qt5::" prefix, such as "Qt5::Widgets". All of the package-specific variables have a consistent name with its package name as prefix.
For example, find_package(Qt5 COMPONENTS Widgets), when successful, makes the following variables available:

db:td.db:para: A string that describes the module's version.
A list of libraries for use with the target_link_libraries command.
A list of directories for use with the include_directories command.
A list of definitions for use with the add_definitions command.
A list of definitions for use with the COMPILE_DEFINITIONS target property.
A boolean that describes whether the module was found successfully.
A string of flags to use when building executables.

db:section.db:para: For all packages found with find_package, equivalents of these variables are available; they are case-sensitive.

db:section.db:title: Installation variables
db:section.db:para: Additionally, there are also variables that don't relate to a particular package, but to the Qt installation itself.

db:td.db:para: On Unix, a boolean that describes whether Qt libraries and plugins were compiled with -fvisibility=hidden. This means that only selected symbols are exported.
A string that holds the infix used in library names, when Qt is configured with -libinfix.
